metadata.title: 5122-1 -- Apport vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that Apport could be tricked into writing core files as root into arbitrary directories in certain scenarios. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to escalate privileges. This update will cause Apport to generate all core files in the /var/lib/apport/coredump directory. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5122-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: python3-problem-report - 2.20.11-0ubuntu71 apport-kde - 2.20.11-0ubuntu71 apport-retrace - 2.20.11-0ubuntu71 apport-valgrind - 2.20.11-0ubuntu71 python3-apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu71 dh-apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu71 apport-gtk - 2.20.11-0ubuntu71 apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu71 apport-noui - 2.20.11-0ubuntu71 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5479-1 -- PHP vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Charles Fol discovered that PHP incorrectly handled initializing certain arrays when handling the pg_query_params function. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-31625) Charles Fol discovered that PHP incorrectly handled passwords in mysqlnd. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-31626) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5479-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: php8.0-fpm - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-enchant - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-xml - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-dba - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-xsl - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-mbstring - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-opcache - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-cli - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-snmp - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-phpdbg - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-tidy - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-zip - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-gmp - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-interbase - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 libapache2-mod-php8.0 - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-bcmath - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-dev - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-ldap - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-soap - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-curl - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-intl - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-pspell - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-odbc - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-sybase - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0 - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-gd - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-bz2 - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-mysql - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-readline - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-sqlite3 - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 libphp8.0-embed - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-pgsql - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-common - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-cgi - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 php8.0-imap - 8.0.8-1ubuntu0.4 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5233-1 -- ClamAV vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that ClamAV incorrectly handled memory when the CL_SCAN_GENERAL_COLLECT_METADATA scan option was enabled. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause ClamAV to crash, resulting in a denial of service. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5233-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: libclamav-dev - 0.103.5+dfsg-1~21.10.1 clamav-testfiles - 0.103.5+dfsg-1~21.10.1 clamav-base - 0.103.5+dfsg-1~21.10.1 clamav - 0.103.5+dfsg-1~21.10.1 clamav-daemon - 0.103.5+dfsg-1~21.10.1 clamav-milter - 0.103.5+dfsg-1~21.10.1 clamav-docs - 0.103.5+dfsg-1~21.10.1 clamav-freshclam - 0.103.5+dfsg-1~21.10.1 libclamav9 - 0.103.5+dfsg-1~21.10.1 clamdscan - 0.103.5+dfsg-1~21.10.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5255-1 -- WebKitGTK vulnerabilities
metadata.description: A large number of security issues were discovered in the WebKitGTK Web and JavaScript engines. If a user were tricked into viewing a malicious website, a remote attacker could exploit a variety of issues related to web browser security, including cross-site scripting attacks, denial of service attacks, and arbitrary code execution. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5255-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.34.4-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-dev - 2.34.4-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.34.4-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 webkit2gtk-driver - 2.34.4-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.34.4-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 libwebkit2gtk-4.0-doc - 2.34.4-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.34.4-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.34.4-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 libwebkit2gtk-4.0-dev - 2.34.4-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5355-1 -- zlib vulnerability
metadata.description: Danilo Ramos discovered that zlib incorrectly handled memory when performing certain deflating operations. An attacker could use this issue to cause zlib to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5355-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: libx32z1-dev - 1:1.2.11.dfsg-2ubuntu7.1 lib64z1 - 1:1.2.11.dfsg-2ubuntu7.1 libx32z1 - 1:1.2.11.dfsg-2ubuntu7.1 lib64z1-dev - 1:1.2.11.dfsg-2ubuntu7.1 lib32z1 - 1:1.2.11.dfsg-2ubuntu7.1 zlib1g - 1:1.2.11.dfsg-2ubuntu7.1 lib32z1-dev - 1:1.2.11.dfsg-2ubuntu7.1 zlib1g-dev - 1:1.2.11.dfsg-2ubuntu7.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5358-2 -- Linux kernel vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that the network traffic control implementation in the Linux kernel contained a use-after-free vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-1055) It was discovered that the IPsec implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly allocate enough memory when performing ESP transformations, leading to a heap-based buffer overflow. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-27666) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5358-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: linux-headers-5.13.0-1021-azure - 5.13.0-1021.24 linux-buildinfo-5.13.0-1021-azure - 5.13.0-1021.24 linux-azure-cloud-tools-5.13.0-1021 - metadata.title: 5358-1 -- Linux kernel vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that the network traffic control implementation in the Linux kernel contained a use-after-free vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-1055) It was discovered that the IPsec implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly allocate enough memory when performing ESP transformations, leading to a heap-based buffer overflow. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-27666) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5358-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: linux-modules-extra-gke - 5.13.0.1023.21 linux-tools-gke - 5.13.0.1023.21 linux-tools-gcp - 5.13.0.1023.21 linux-gke - metadata.title: 5275-1 -- BlueZ vulnerability
metadata.description: Ziming Zhang discovered that BlueZ incorrectly handled memory write operations in its gatt server. A remote attacker could possibly use this to cause BlueZ to crash leading to a denial of service, or potentially remotely execute code. (CVE-2022-0204) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5275-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: libbluetooth3 - 5.60-0ubuntu2.2 bluez-tests - 5.60-0ubuntu2.2 bluez-obexd - 5.60-0ubuntu2.2 bluetooth - 5.60-0ubuntu2.2 bluez - 5.60-0ubuntu2.2 bluez-hcidump - 5.60-0ubuntu2.2 bluez-meshd - 5.60-0ubuntu2.2 bluez-cups - 5.60-0ubuntu2.2 libbluetooth-dev - 5.60-0ubuntu2.2 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5313-1 -- OpenJDK vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that OpenJDK incorrectly handled deserialization filters. An attacker could possibly use this issue to insert, delete or obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2022-21248) It was discovered that OpenJDK incorrectly read uncompressed TIFF files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service via a specially crafted TIFF file. (CVE-2022-21277) Jonni Passki discovered that OpenJDK incorrectly verified access restrictions when performing URI resolution. An attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2022-21282) It was discovered that OpenJDK incorrectly handled certain regular expressions in the Pattern class implementation. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2022-21283) It was discovered that OpenJDK incorrectly handled specially crafted Java class files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2022-21291) Markus Loewe discovered that OpenJDK incorrectly validated attributes during object deserialization. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2022-21293, CVE-2022-21294) Dan Rabe discovered that OpenJDK incorrectly verified access permissions in the JAXP component. An attacker could possibly use this to specially craft an XML file to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2022-21296) It was discovered that OpenJDK incorrectly handled XML entities. An attacker could use this to specially craft an XML file that, when parsed, would possibly cause a denial of service. (CVE-2022-21299) Zhiqiang Zang discovered that OpenJDK incorrectly handled array indexes. An attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2022-21305) It was discovered that OpenJDK incorrectly read very long attributes values in JAR file manifests. An attacker could possibly use this to specially craft JAR file to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2022-21340) It was discovered that OpenJDK incorrectly validated input from serialized streams. An attacker cold possibly use this issue to bypass sandbox restrictions. (CVE-2022-21341) Fabian Meumertzheim discovered that OpenJDK incorrectly handled certain specially crafted BMP or TIFF files. An attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2022-21360, CVE-2022-21366) It was discovered that an integer overflow could be triggered in OpenJDK BMPImageReader class implementation. An attacker could possibly use this to specially craft a BMP file to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2022-21365) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5313-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: openjdk-17-demo - 17.0.2+8-1~22.10 openjdk-17-jdk - 17.0.2+8-1~22.10 openjdk-17-jre-zero - 17.0.2+8-1~22.10 openjdk-17-jdk-headless - 17.0.2+8-1~22.10 openjdk-17-source - 17.0.2+8-1~22.10 openjdk-17-jre-headless - 17.0.2+8-1~22.10 openjdk-17-jre - 17.0.2+8-1~22.10 openjdk-17-doc - 17.0.2+8-1~22.10 No subscription required openjdk-11-source - 11.0.14+9-0ubuntu2~22.10 openjdk-11-doc - 11.0.14+9-0ubuntu2~22.10 openjdk-11-jre-zero - 11.0.14+9-0ubuntu2~22.10 openjdk-11-jre-headless - 11.0.14+9-0ubuntu2~22.10 openjdk-11-jdk - 11.0.14+9-0ubuntu2~22.10 openjdk-11-jdk-headless - 11.0.14+9-0ubuntu2~22.10 openjdk-11-jre - 11.0.14+9-0ubuntu2~22.10 openjdk-11-demo - 11.0.14+9-0ubuntu2~22.10 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5475-1 -- Firefox vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Multiple security issues were discovered in Firefox. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service, obtain sensitive information, spoof the browser UI, conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks, bypass content security policy (CSP) restrictions, or execute arbitrary code. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5475-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox-locale-nl - 101.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 firefox-locale-nn - 101.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 firefox-locale-ne - metadata.title: 5250-1 -- strongSwan vulnerability
metadata.description: Zhuowei Zhang discovered that stringSwan incorrectly handled EAP authentication. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause strongSwan to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly bypass client and server authentication. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5250-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: strongswan-nm - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2 strongswan-scepclient - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2 libcharon-extra-plugins - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2 strongswan-swanctl - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2 libstrongswan-extra-plugins - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2 strongswan-charon - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2 libstrongswan - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2 libstrongswan-standard-plugins - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2 libcharon-extauth-plugins - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2 charon-systemd - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2 strongswan - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2 charon-cmd - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2 strongswan-pki - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2 strongswan-starter - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2 strongswan-libcharon - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5316-1 -- Redis vulnerability
metadata.description: Reginaldo Silva discovered that due to a packaging issue, a remote attacker with the ability to execute arbitrary Lua scripts could possibly escape the Lua sandbox and execute arbitrary code on the host. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5316-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: redis - 5:6.0.15-1ubuntu0.1 redis-server - 5:6.0.15-1ubuntu0.1 redis-sentinel - 5:6.0.15-1ubuntu0.1 redis-tools - 5:6.0.15-1ubuntu0.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5393-1 -- Thunderbird vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Multiple security issues were discovered in Thunderbird. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted website in a browsing context, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service, conduct spoofing attacks, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-1097, CVE-2022-1196, CVE-2022-28281, CVE-2022-28282, CVE-2022-28285, CVE-2022-28286, CVE-2022-28289) It was discovered that Thunderbird ignored OpenPGP revocation when importing a revoked key in some circumstances. An attacker could potentially exploit this by tricking the user into trusting the authenticity of a message or tricking them into use a revoked key to send an encrypted message. (CVE-2022-1197) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5393-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: thunderbird-locale-es-ar - 1:91.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 thunderbird-locale-br - 1:91.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 thunderbird-locale-bn - metadata.title: 5397-1 -- curl vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Patrick Monnerat discovered that curl incorrectly handled certain OAUTH2. An attacker could possibly use this issue to access sensitive information. (CVE-2022-22576) Harry Sintonen discovered that curl incorrectly handled certain requests. An attacker could possibly use this issue to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2022-27774, CVE-2022-27775, CVE-2022-27776) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5397-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: libcurl4-gnutls-dev - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.1 libcurl4-openssl-dev - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.1 libcurl3-gnutls - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.1 libcurl4-doc - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.1 libcurl3-nss - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.1 libcurl4-nss-dev - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.1 libcurl4 - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.1 curl - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5193-1 -- X.Org X Server vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Jan-Niklas Sohn discovered that the X.Org X Server incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could use this issue to cause the server to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code and escalate privileges. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5193-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1.1 xorg-server-source - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1.1 xdmx - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1.1 xserver-xorg-dev - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1.1 xvfb - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1.1 xnest - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1.1 xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1.1 xdmx-tools - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1.1 xserver-xephyr - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1.1 xserver-common - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1.1 No subscription required xwayland - 2:21.1.2-0ubuntu1.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5192-1 -- Apache Log4j 2 vulnerability
metadata.description: Chen Zhaojun discovered that Apache Log4j 2 allows remote attackers to run programs via a special crafted input. An attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code. Please see the following link for more information: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/KnowledgeBase/Log4Shell Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5192-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: liblog4j2-java - 2.15.0-0.21.10.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5312-1 -- HAProxy vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that HAProxy incorrectly handled certain headers. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause HAProxy to stop responding, resulting in a denial of service. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5312-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: haproxy - 2.2.9-2ubuntu2.1 haproxy-doc - 2.2.9-2ubuntu2.1 vim-haproxy - 2.2.9-2ubuntu2.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5348-1 -- Smarty vulnerabilities
metadata.description: David Gnedt and Thomas Konrad discovered that Smarty was incorrectly sanitizing the paths present in the templates. An attacker could possibly use this use to read arbitrary files when controlling the executed template. (CVE-2018-13982) It was discovered that Smarty was incorrectly sanitizing the paths present in the templates. An attacker could possibly use this use to read arbitrary files when controlling the executed template. (CVE-2018-16831) It was discovered that Smarty was incorrectly validating security policy data, allowing the execution of static classes even when not permitted by the security settings. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2021-21408) It was discovered that Smarty was incorrectly managing access control to template objects, which allowed users to perform a sandbox escape. An attacker could possibly use this issue to send specially crafted input to applications that use Smarty and execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2021-26119) It was discovered that Smarty was not checking for special characters when setting function names during plugin compile operations. An attacker could possibly use this issue to send specially crafted input to applications that use Smarty and execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2021-26120) It was discovered that Smarty was incorrectly sanitizing characters in math strings processed by the math function. An attacker could possibly use this issue to send specially crafted input to applications that use Smarty and execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2021-29454) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5348-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: smarty3 - 3.1.39-2ubuntu0.21.10.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5134-1 -- Docker vulnerability
metadata.description: An information disclosure issue was discovered in the command line interface of Docker. A misconfigured credential store could result in supplied credentials being leaked to the public registry, when using the docker login command with a private registry. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5134-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: golang-github-docker-docker-dev - 20.10.7-0ubuntu5.1 docker.io - 20.10.7-0ubuntu5.1 golang-docker-dev - 20.10.7-0ubuntu5.1 vim-syntax-docker - 20.10.7-0ubuntu5.1 docker-doc - 20.10.7-0ubuntu5.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5424-1 -- OpenLDAP vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that OpenLDAP incorrectly handled certain SQL statements within LDAP queries in the experimental back-sql backend. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to perform an SQL injection attack and alter the database. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5424-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: libldap-dev - 2.5.6+dfsg-1~exp1ubuntu1.1 libldap-common - 2.5.6+dfsg-1~exp1ubuntu1.1 slapd-smbk5pwd - 2.5.6+dfsg-1~exp1ubuntu1.1 slapd-contrib - 2.5.6+dfsg-1~exp1ubuntu1.1 libldap-2.5-0 - 2.5.6+dfsg-1~exp1ubuntu1.1 slapi-dev - 2.5.6+dfsg-1~exp1ubuntu1.1 ldap-utils - 2.5.6+dfsg-1~exp1ubuntu1.1 libldap2-dev - 2.5.6+dfsg-1~exp1ubuntu1.1 slapd - 2.5.6+dfsg-1~exp1ubuntu1.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5366-1 -- FriBidi vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that FriBidi incorrectly handled processing of input strings resulting in memory corruption. An attacker could use this issue to cause FriBidi to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or potentially execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-25308) It was discovered that FriBidi incorrectly validated input data to its CapRTL unicode encoder, resulting in memory corruption. An attacker could use this issue to cause FriBidi to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or potentially execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-25309) It was discovered that FriBidi incorrectly handled empty input when removing marks from unicode strings, resulting in a crash. An attacker could use this to cause FriBidi to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or potentially execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-25310) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5366-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: libfribidi-bin - 1.0.8-2ubuntu2.1 libfribidi0 - 1.0.8-2ubuntu2.1 libfribidi-dev - 1.0.8-2ubuntu2.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5293-1 -- c3p0 vulnerability
metadata.description: Aaron Massey discovered that c3p0 could be made to crash when parsing certain input. An attacker able to modify the application's XML configuration file could cause a denial of service. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5293-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: libc3p0-java-doc - 0.9.1.2-10ubuntu0.21.10.1 libc3p0-java - 0.9.1.2-10ubuntu0.21.10.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5179-1 -- BusyBox vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that BusyBox incorrectly handled certain malformed gzip archives. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted gzip archive, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause BusyBox to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2021-28831) It was discovered that BusyBox incorrectly handled certain malformed LZMA archives. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted LZMA archive, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause BusyBox to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly leak sensitive information. (CVE-2021-42374) Vera Mens, Uri Katz, Tal Keren, Sharon Brizinov, and Shachar Menashe discovered that BusyBox incorrectly handled certain awk patterns. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted awk pattern, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause BusyBox to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2021-42378, CVE-2021-42379, CVE-2021-42380, CVE-2021-42381, CVE-2021-42382, CVE-2021-42384, CVE-2021-42385, CVE-2021-42386) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5179-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: busybox - 1:1.30.1-6ubuntu3.1 busybox-syslogd - 1:1.30.1-6ubuntu3.1 udhcpd - 1:1.30.1-6ubuntu3.1 busybox-initramfs - 1:1.30.1-6ubuntu3.1 udhcpc - 1:1.30.1-6ubuntu3.1 busybox-static - 1:1.30.1-6ubuntu3.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5157-1 -- Postorius vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that Postorius mishandled specially crafted input. An attacker could use this vulnerability that obtain sensitive information. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5157-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: python3-django-postorius - 1.3.4-2ubuntu0.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5249-1 -- USBView vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that USBView allowed unprivileged users to run usbview as root. A local attacker could use this vulnerability to gain administrative privileges or cause a denial of service. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5249-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: usbview - 2.0-21-g6fe2f4f-2ubuntu0.21.10.3 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5440-1 -- PostgreSQL vulnerability
metadata.description: Alexander Lakhin discovered that PostgreSQL incorrectly handled the security restricted operation sandbox when a privileged user is maintaining another user's objects. An attacker having permission to create non-temp objects can use this issue to execute arbitrary commands as the superuser. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5440-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: postgresql-server-dev-13 - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 libecpg6 - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 libpq-dev - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 postgresql-pltcl-13 - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 libpgtypes3 - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 postgresql-plperl-13 - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 postgresql-13 - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 libecpg-dev - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 postgresql-plpython3-13 - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 libpq5 - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 postgresql-doc-13 - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 postgresql-client-13 - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 libecpg-compat3 - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5325-1 -- Zsh vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Sam Foxman discovered that Zsh incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to regain dropped privileges. (CVE-2019-20044) It was discovered that Zsh incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2021-45444) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5325-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: zsh-static - 5.8-6ubuntu0.1 zsh-common - 5.8-6ubuntu0.1 zsh-dev - 5.8-6ubuntu0.1 zsh - 5.8-6ubuntu0.1 zsh-doc - 5.8-6ubuntu0.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5483-1 -- Exempi vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that Exempi incorrectly handled certain media files. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted file, a remote attacker could cause Exempi to stop responding or crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5483-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: libexempi8 - 2.5.2-1ubuntu0.21.10.1 exempi - 2.5.2-1ubuntu0.21.10.1 libexempi-dev - 2.5.2-1ubuntu0.21.10.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5154-1 -- FreeRDP vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that FreeRDP incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code or cause a crash. (CVE-2021-41159) It was discovered that FreeRDP incorrectly handled certain connections. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code or cause a crash. (CVE-2021-41160) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5154-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu0.1 freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu0.1 libfreerdp2-2 - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu0.1 freerdp2-dev - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu0.1 freerdp2-wayland - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu0.1 libwinpr2-dev - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu0.1 libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu0.1 libuwac0-0 - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu0.1 freerdp2-x11 - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu0.1 libwinpr2-2 - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu0.1 libuwac0-dev - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu0.1 libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu0.1 libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu0.1 libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu0.1 winpr-utils - 2.3.0+dfsg1-2ubuntu0.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5320-1 -- Expat vulnerabilities and regression
metadata.description: USN-5288-1 fixed several vulnerabilities in Expat. For CVE-2022-25236 it caused a regression and an additional patch was required. This update address this regression and several other vulnerabilities. It was discovered that Expat incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2022-25313) It was discovered that Expat incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a crash or execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS, Ubuntu 20.04 LTS, and Ubuntu 21.10. (CVE-2022-25314) It was discovered that Expat incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a crash or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-25315) Original advisory details: It was discovered that Expat incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a crash or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-25236) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5320-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: expat - 2.4.1-2ubuntu0.3 libexpat1-dev - 2.4.1-2ubuntu0.3 libexpat1 - 2.4.1-2ubuntu0.3 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5309-1 -- virglrenderer vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that virglrenderer incorrectly handled memory. An attacker inside a guest could use this issue to cause virglrenderer to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-0135) It was discovered that virglrenderer incorrectly initialized memory. An attacker inside a guest could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive host information. (CVE-2022-0175) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5309-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: libvirglrenderer1 - 0.8.2-5ubuntu0.21.10.1 virgl-server - 0.8.2-5ubuntu0.21.10.1 libvirglrenderer-dev - 0.8.2-5ubuntu0.21.10.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5304-1 -- PolicyKit vulnerability
metadata.description: Kevin Backhouse discovered that PolicyKit incorrectly handled file descriptors. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to cause PolicyKit to crash, resulting in a denial of service. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5304-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: policykit-1-doc - 0.105-31ubuntu0.2 libpolkit-gobject-1-dev - 0.105-31ubuntu0.2 libpolkit-agent-1-0 - 0.105-31ubuntu0.2 libpolkit-agent-1-dev - 0.105-31ubuntu0.2 policykit-1 - 0.105-31ubuntu0.2 gir1.2-polkit-1.0 - 0.105-31ubuntu0.2 libpolkit-gobject-1-0 - 0.105-31ubuntu0.2 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5202-1 -- OpenJDK vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Varnavas Papaioannou discovered that the FTP client implementation in OpenJDK accepted alternate server IP addresses when connecting with FTP passive mode. An attacker controlling an FTP server that an application connects to could possibly use this to expose sensitive information (rudimentary port scans). This issue only affected Ubuntu 16.04 ESM, Ubuntu 18.04 LTS, Ubuntu 20.04 LTS, and Ubuntu 21.04. (CVE-2021-2341) Markus Loewe discovered that OpenJDK did not properly handle JAR files containing multiple manifest files. An attacker could possibly use this to bypass JAR signature verification. This issue only affected Ubuntu 16.04 ESM, Ubuntu 18.04 LTS, Ubuntu 20.04 LTS, and Ubuntu 21.04. (CVE-2021-2369) Huixin Ma discovered that the Hotspot VM in OpenJDK did not properly perform range check elimination in some situations. An attacker could possibly use this to construct a Java class that could bypass Java sandbox restrictions. This issue only affected Ubuntu 16.04 ESM, Ubuntu 18.04 LTS, Ubuntu 20.04 LTS, and Ubuntu 21.04. (CVE-2021-2388) Asaf Greenholts discovered that OpenJDK preferred certain weak ciphers by default. An attacker could possibly use this to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2021-35550) It was discovered that the Rich Text Format (RTF) Parser in OpenJDK did not properly restrict the amount of memory allocated in some situations. An attacker could use this to specially craft an RTF file that caused a denial of service. (CVE-2021-35556) It was discovered that the Rich Text Format (RTF) Reader in OpenJDK did not properly restrict the amount of memory allocated in some situations. An attacker could use this to specially craft an RTF file that caused a denial of service. (CVE-2021-35559) Markus Loewe discovered that the HashMap and HashSet implementations in OpenJDK did not properly validate load factors during deserialization. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (excessive memory consumption). (CVE-2021-35561) It was discovered that the Keytool component in OpenJDK did not properly handle certificates with validity ending dates in the far future. An attacker could use this to specially craft a certificate that when imported could corrupt a keystore. (CVE-2021-35564) Tristen Hayfield discovered that the HTTP server implementation in OpenJDK did not properly handle TLS session close in some situations. A remote attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (application infinite loop). (CVE-2021-35565) Chuck Hunley discovered that the Kerberos implementation in OpenJDK did not correctly report subject principals when using Kerberos Constrained Delegation. An attacker could possibly use this to cause incorrect Kerberos tickets to be used. (CVE-2021-35567) it was discovered that the TLS implementation in OpenJDK did not properly handle TLS handshakes in certain situations where a Java application is acting as a TLS server. A remote attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (application crash). (CVE-2021-35578) it was discovered that OpenJDK did not properly restrict the amount of memory allocated when processing BMP images. An attacker could use this to specially craft a BMP image file that could cause a denial of service. (CVE-2021-35586) It was discovered that the HotSpot VM in OpenJDK 8 did not properly perform validation of inner class index values in some situations. An attacker could use this to specially craft a class file that when loaded could cause a denial of service (Java VM crash). (CVE-2021-35588) Artem Smotrakov discovered that the TLS implementation in OpenJDK used non- constant time comparisons during TLS handshakes. A remote attacker could use this to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2021-35603) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5202-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: openjdk-8-source - 8u312-b07-0ubuntu1~21.10 openjdk-8-doc - 8u312-b07-0ubuntu1~21.10 openjdk-8-jdk - 8u312-b07-0ubuntu1~21.10 openjdk-8-jre-headless - 8u312-b07-0ubuntu1~21.10 openjdk-8-jdk-headless - 8u312-b07-0ubuntu1~21.10 openjdk-8-jre - 8u312-b07-0ubuntu1~21.10 openjdk-8-jre-zero - 8u312-b07-0ubuntu1~21.10 openjdk-8-demo - 8u312-b07-0ubuntu1~21.10 No subscription required openjdk-11-doc - 11.0.13+8-0ubuntu1~21.10 openjdk-11-jre-zero - 11.0.13+8-0ubuntu1~21.10 openjdk-11-source - 11.0.13+8-0ubuntu1~21.10 openjdk-11-jre-headless - 11.0.13+8-0ubuntu1~21.10 openjdk-11-jdk - 11.0.13+8-0ubuntu1~21.10 openjdk-11-jdk-headless - 11.0.13+8-0ubuntu1~21.10 openjdk-11-jre - 11.0.13+8-0ubuntu1~21.10 openjdk-11-demo - 11.0.13+8-0ubuntu1~21.10 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5383-1 -- Linux kernel vulnerabilities
metadata.description: David Bouman discovered that the netfilter subsystem in the Linux kernel did not properly validate passed user register indices. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-1015) Brendan Dolan-Gavitt discovered that the Marvell WiFi-Ex USB device driver in the Linux kernel did not properly handle some error conditions. A physically proximate attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2021-43976) Wenqing Liu discovered that the f2fs file system implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly validate inode types while performing garbage collection. An attacker could use this to construct a malicious f2fs image that, when mounted and operated on, could cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2021-44879) It was discovered that the UDF file system implementation in the Linux kernel could attempt to dereference a null pointer in some situations. An attacker could use this to construct a malicious UDF image that, when mounted and operated on, could cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2022-0617) David Bouman discovered that the netfilter subsystem in the Linux kernel did not initialize memory in some situations. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information (kernel memory). (CVE-2022-1016) Lyu Tao discovered that the NFS implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly handle requests to open a directory on a regular file. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information (kernel memory). (CVE-2022-24448) It was discovered that the VirtIO Bluetooth driver in the Linux kernel did not properly deallocate memory in some error conditions. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (memory exhaustion). (CVE-2022-26878) It was discovered that the YAM AX.25 device driver in the Linux kernel did not properly deallocate memory in some error conditions. A local privileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (kernel memory exhaustion). (CVE-2022-24959) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5383-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: linux-modules-extra-gke - 5.13.0.1024.22 linux-modules-extra-gcp - 5.13.0.1024.22 linux-tools-gke - 5.13.0.1024.22 linux-tools-gcp - metadata.title: 5240-1 -- Linux kernel vulnerability
metadata.description: William Liu and Jamie Hill-Daniel discovered that the file system context functionality in the Linux kernel contained an integer underflow vulnerability, leading to an out-of-bounds write. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or execute arbitrary code. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5240-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: linux-buildinfo-5.13.0-27-generic-lpae - 5.13.0-27.29 linux-buildinfo-5.13.0-27-lowlatency - 5.13.0-27.29 linux-tools-common - metadata.title: 5301-1 -- Cyrus SASL vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that the Cyrus SASL SQL plugin incorrectly handled SQL input. A remote attacker could use this issue to execute arbitrary SQL commands. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5301-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: libsasl2-2 - 2.1.27+dfsg-2.1ubuntu0.1 libsasl2-modules-gssapi-heimdal - 2.1.27+dfsg-2.1ubuntu0.1 sasl2-bin - 2.1.27+dfsg-2.1ubuntu0.1 libsasl2-modules-db - 2.1.27+dfsg-2.1ubuntu0.1 libsasl2-modules-gssapi-mit - 2.1.27+dfsg-2.1ubuntu0.1 libsasl2-dev - 2.1.27+dfsg-2.1ubuntu0.1 libsasl2-modules-sql - 2.1.27+dfsg-2.1ubuntu0.1 libsasl2-modules - 2.1.27+dfsg-2.1ubuntu0.1 libsasl2-modules-otp - 2.1.27+dfsg-2.1ubuntu0.1 libsasl2-modules-ldap - 2.1.27+dfsg-2.1ubuntu0.1 cyrus-sasl2-doc - 2.1.27+dfsg-2.1ubuntu0.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5486-1 -- Intel Microcode vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that some Intel processors did not implement sufficient control flow management. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2021-0127) Joseph Nuzman discovered that some Intel processors did not properly initialise shared resources. A local attacker could use this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2021-0145) Mark Ermolov, Dmitry Sklyarov and Maxim Goryachy discovered that some Intel processors did not prevent test and debug logic from being activated at runtime. A local attacker could use this to escalate privileges. (CVE-2021-0146) It was discovered that some Intel processors did not properly restrict access in some situations. A local attacker could use this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2021-33117) Brandon Miller discovered that some Intel processors did not properly restrict access in some situations. A local attacker could use this to obtain sensitive information or a remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2021-33120) It was discovered that some Intel processors did not completely perform cleanup actions on multi-core shared buffers. A local attacker could possibly use this to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2022-21123, CVE-2022-21127) Alysa Milburn, Jason Brandt, Avishai Redelman and Nir Lavi discovered that some Intel processors improperly optimised security-critical code. A local attacker could possibly use this to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2022-21151) It was discovered that some Intel processors did not properly perform cleanup during specific special register write operations. A local attacker could possibly use this to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2022-21166) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5486-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: intel-microcode - 3.20220510.0ubuntu0.21.10.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5286-1 -- cryptsetup vulnerability
metadata.description: Milan Broz discovered that cryptsetup incorrectly handled LUKS2 reencryption recovery. An attacker with physical access to modify the encrypted device header may trigger the device to be unencrypted the next time it is mounted by the user. On Ubuntu 20.04 LTS, this issue was fixed by disabling the online reencryption feature. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5286-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: cryptsetup - 2:2.3.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 cryptsetup-run - 2:2.3.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 libcryptsetup12 - 2:2.3.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 libcryptsetup-dev - 2:2.3.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 cryptsetup-bin - 2:2.3.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 cryptsetup-initramfs - 2:2.3.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5168-1 -- NSS vulnerability
metadata.description: Tavis Ormandy discovered that NSS incorrectly handled verifying DSA/RSA-PSS signatures. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause NSS to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5168-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: libnss3-dev - 2:3.68-1ubuntu1.1 libnss3 - 2:3.68-1ubuntu1.1 libnss3-tools - 2:3.68-1ubuntu1.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5168-2 -- Thunderbird vulnerability
metadata.description: Tavis Ormandy discovered that NSS, included with Thunderbird, incorrectly handled verifying DSA/RSA-PSS signatures. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Thunderbird to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5168-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: thunderbird-locale-es-ar - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.2 thunderbird-locale-br - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.2 thunderbird-locale-bn - metadata.title: 5188-1 -- Keepalived vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that Keepalived incorrectly handled certain messages. An attacker could possibly use this issue to access-control bypass. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5188-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: keepalived - 1:2.1.5-0.2ubuntu1.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5222-1 -- Apache Log4j 2 vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that Apache Log4j 2 was vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) attack when configured to use a JDBC Appender with a JNDI LDAP data source URI. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a crash, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2021-44832) Hideki Okamoto and Guy Lederfein discovered that Apache Log4j 2 did not protect against infinite recursion in lookup evaluation. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Apache Log4j 2 to crash, leading to a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS. (CVE-2021-45105) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5222-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: liblog4j2-java - 2.17.1-0.21.10.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5404-1 -- Rsyslog vulnerability
metadata.description: Pieter Agten discovered that Rsyslog incorrectly handled certain requests. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a crash. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5404-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: rsyslog-gssapi - 8.2102.0-2ubuntu2.2 rsyslog-czmq - 8.2102.0-2ubuntu2.2 rsyslog-pgsql - 8.2102.0-2ubuntu2.2 rsyslog-hiredis - 8.2102.0-2ubuntu2.2 rsyslog-mysql - 8.2102.0-2ubuntu2.2 rsyslog-gnutls - 8.2102.0-2ubuntu2.2 rsyslog-openssl - 8.2102.0-2ubuntu2.2 rsyslog - 8.2102.0-2ubuntu2.2 rsyslog-relp - 8.2102.0-2ubuntu2.2 rsyslog-mongodb - 8.2102.0-2ubuntu2.2 rsyslog-elasticsearch - 8.2102.0-2ubuntu2.2 rsyslog-kafka - 8.2102.0-2ubuntu2.2 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5463-1 -- NTFS-3G vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that NTFS-3G incorrectly handled the ntfsck tool. If a user or automated system were tricked into using ntfsck on a specially crafted disk image, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2021-46790) Roman Fiedler discovered that NTFS-3G incorrectly handled certain return codes. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to intercept protocol traffic between FUSE and the kernel. (CVE-2022-30783) It was discovered that NTFS-3G incorrectly handled certain NTFS disk images. If a user or automated system were tricked into mounting a specially crafted disk image, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-30784, CVE-2022-30786, CVE-2022-30788, CVE-2022-30789) Roman Fiedler discovered that NTFS-3G incorrectly handled certain file handles. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to read and write arbitrary memory. (CVE-2022-30785, CVE-2022-30787) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5463-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: ntfs-3g - 1:2017.3.23AR.3-3ubuntu5.1 libntfs-3g883 - 1:2017.3.23AR.3-3ubuntu5.1 ntfs-3g-dev - 1:2017.3.23AR.3-3ubuntu5.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5354-1 -- Twisted vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that Twisted incorrectly filtered HTTP headers when clients are being redirected to another origin. A remote attacker could use this issue to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2022-21712) It was discovered that Twisted incorrectly processed SSH handshake data on connection establishments. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Twisted to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2022-21716) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5354-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: twisted-doc - 20.3.0-7ubuntu1.1 python3-twisted-bin - 20.3.0-7ubuntu1.1 python3-twisted - 20.3.0-7ubuntu1.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5270-1 -- MySQL vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Multiple security issues were discovered in MySQL and this update includes new upstream MySQL versions to fix these issues. MySQL has been updated to 8.0.28 in Ubuntu 20.04 LTS and Ubuntu 21.10. Ubuntu 18.04 LTS has been updated to MySQL 5.7.37. In addition to security fixes, the updated packages contain bug fixes, new features, and possibly incompatible changes. Please see the following for more information: https://dev.mysql.com/doc/relnotes/mysql/5.7/en/news-5-7-37.html https://dev.mysql.com/doc/relnotes/mysql/8.0/en/news-8-0-28.html https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2022.html Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5270-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: mysql-client - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.21.10.3 mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.21.10.3 libmysqlclient-dev - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.21.10.3 mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.21.10.3 mysql-router - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.21.10.3 mysql-server - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.21.10.3 libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.21.10.3 mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.21.10.3 mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.21.10.3 mysql-testsuite - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.21.10.3 mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.21.10.3 mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.21.10.3 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5126-1 -- Bind vulnerability
metadata.description: Kishore Kumar Kothapalli discovered that Bind incorrectly handled the lame cache when processing responses. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Bind to consume resources, resulting in a denial of service. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5126-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: dnsutils - 1:9.16.15-1ubuntu1.1 bind9-libs - 1:9.16.15-1ubuntu1.1 bind9utils - 1:9.16.15-1ubuntu1.1 bind9-dev - 1:9.16.15-1ubuntu1.1 bind9-doc - 1:9.16.15-1ubuntu1.1 bind9-utils - 1:9.16.15-1ubuntu1.1 bind9 - 1:9.16.15-1ubuntu1.1 bind9-dnsutils - 1:9.16.15-1ubuntu1.1 bind9-host - 1:9.16.15-1ubuntu1.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5317-1 -- Linux kernel vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Nick Gregory discovered that the Linux kernel incorrectly handled network offload functionality. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-25636) Enrico Barberis, Pietro Frigo, Marius Muench, Herbert Bos, and Cristiano Giuffrida discovered that hardware mitigations added by ARM to their processors to address Spectre-BTI were insufficient. A local attacker could potentially use this to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2022-23960) Max Kellermann discovered that the Linux kernel incorrectly handled Unix pipes. A local attacker could potentially use this to modify any file that could be opened for reading. (CVE-2022-0847) Enrico Barberis, Pietro Frigo, Marius Muench, Herbert Bos, and Cristiano Giuffrida discovered that hardware mitigations added by Intel to their processors to address Spectre-BTI were insufficient. A local attacker could potentially use this to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2022-0001, CVE-2022-0002) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5317-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: linux-image-5.13.0-35-generic - 5.13.0-35.40 linux-buildinfo-5.13.0-35-generic - 5.13.0-35.40 linux-tools-common - metadata.title: 5147-1 -- Vim vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that Vim incorrectly handled permissions on the .swp file. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 ESM. (CVE-2017-17087) It was discovered that Vim incorrectly handled restricted mode. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass restricted mode and execute arbitrary commands. Note: This update only makes executing shell commands more difficult. Restricted mode should not be considered a complete security measure. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 ESM. (CVE-2019-20807) Brian Carpenter discovered that vim incorrectly handled memory when opening certain files. If a user was tricked into opening a specially crafted file, a remote attacker could crash the application, leading to a denial of service, or possible execute arbitrary code with user privileges. This issue only affected Ubuntu 20.04 LTS, Ubuntu 21.04 and Ubuntu 21.10. (CVE-2021-3872) It was discovered that vim incorrectly handled memory when opening certain files. If a user was tricked into opening a specially crafted file, a remote attacker could crash the application, leading to a denial of service, or possible execute arbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2021-3903) It was discovered that vim incorrectly handled memory when opening certain files. If a user was tricked into opening a specially crafted file, a remote attacker could crash the application, leading to a denial of service, or possible execute arbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2021-3927) It was discovered that vim incorrectly handled memory when opening certain files. If a user was tricked into opening a specially crafted file, a remote attacker could crash the application, leading to a denial of service, or possible execute arbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2021-3928) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5147-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: vim-common - 2:8.2.2434-3ubuntu3.1 vim-athena - 2:8.2.2434-3ubuntu3.1 xxd - 2:8.2.2434-3ubuntu3.1 vim-gtk - 2:8.2.2434-3ubuntu3.1 vim-gui-common - 2:8.2.2434-3ubuntu3.1 vim - 2:8.2.2434-3ubuntu3.1 vim-doc - 2:8.2.2434-3ubuntu3.1 vim-tiny - 2:8.2.2434-3ubuntu3.1 vim-runtime - 2:8.2.2434-3ubuntu3.1 vim-gtk3 - 2:8.2.2434-3ubuntu3.1 vim-nox - 2:8.2.2434-3ubuntu3.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5473-1 -- ca-certificates update
metadata.description: The ca-certificates package contained outdated CA certificates. This update refreshes the included certificates to those contained in the 2.50 version of the Mozilla certificate authority bundle. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5473-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: ca-certificates - 20211016~21.10.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5178-1 -- Django vulnerability
metadata.description: Sjoerd Job Postmus and TengMA discovered that Django incorrectly handled URLs with trailing newlines. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass certain access controls. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5178-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: python3-django - 2:2.2.24-1ubuntu1.1 python-django-doc - 2:2.2.24-1ubuntu1.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5373-1 -- Django vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that Django incorrectly handled certain certain column aliases in the QuerySet.annotate(), aggregate(), and extra() methods. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to perform an SQL injection attack. (CVE-2022-28346) It was discovered that Django incorrectly handled certain option names in the QuerySet.explain() method. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to perform an SQL injection attack. This issue only affected Ubuntu 20.04 LTS, and Ubuntu 21.10. (CVE-2022-28347) It was discovered that the Django URLValidator function incorrectly handled newlines and tabs. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to perform a header injection attack. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS. (CVE-2021-32052) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5373-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: python3-django - 2:2.2.24-1ubuntu1.4 python-django-doc - 2:2.2.24-1ubuntu1.4 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5376-3 -- Git regression
metadata.description: USN-5376-1 fixed vulnerabilities in Git, some patches were missing to properly fix the issue. This update fixes the problem. Original advisory details: 俞晨东 discovered that Git incorrectly handled certain repository paths in platforms with multiple users support. An attacker could possibly use this issue to run arbitrary commands. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5376-3` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: git - 1:2.32.0-1ubuntu1.2 gitweb - 1:2.32.0-1ubuntu1.2 git-all - 1:2.32.0-1ubuntu1.2 git-daemon-sysvinit - 1:2.32.0-1ubuntu1.2 gitk - 1:2.32.0-1ubuntu1.2 git-gui - 1:2.32.0-1ubuntu1.2 git-mediawiki - 1:2.32.0-1ubuntu1.2 git-daemon-run - 1:2.32.0-1ubuntu1.2 git-man - 1:2.32.0-1ubuntu1.2 git-doc - 1:2.32.0-1ubuntu1.2 git-svn - 1:2.32.0-1ubuntu1.2 git-cvs - 1:2.32.0-1ubuntu1.2 git-email - 1:2.32.0-1ubuntu1.2 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5212-1 -- Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that the Apache HTTP Server incorrectly handled certain forward proxy requests. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the server to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly perform a Server Side Request Forgery attack. (CVE-2021-44224) It was discovered that the Apache HTTP Server Lua module incorrectly handled memory in the multipart parser. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the server to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2021-44790) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5212-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: apache2-data - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu3.2 libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu3.2 apache2-utils - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu3.2 apache2-dev - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu3.2 apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu3.2 apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu3.2 apache2 - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu3.2 apache2-doc - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu3.2 libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu3.2 apache2-ssl-dev - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu3.2 apache2-bin - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu3.2 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5330-1 -- LibreOffice vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that LibreOffice incorrectly handled digital signatures. An attacker could possibly use this issue to create a specially crafted document that would display a validly signed indicator, contrary to expectations. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5330-1` to fix the vulnerability. metadata.title: 5372-1 -- Subversion vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Evgeny Kotkov discovered that Subversion servers did not properly follow path-based authorization rules in certain cases. An attacker could potentially use this issue to retrieve information about private paths. (CVE-2021-28544) Thomas Weißschuh discovered that Subversion servers did not properly handle memory in certain configurations. A remote attacker could potentially use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact. (CVE-2022-24070) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5372-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: libsvn-dev - 1.14.1-3ubuntu0.1 ruby-svn - 1.14.1-3ubuntu0.1 python3-subversion - 1.14.1-3ubuntu0.1 subversion-tools - 1.14.1-3ubuntu0.1 libapache2-mod-svn - 1.14.1-3ubuntu0.1 libsvn1 - 1.14.1-3ubuntu0.1 subversion - 1.14.1-3ubuntu0.1 libsvn-doc - 1.14.1-3ubuntu0.1 libsvn-java - 1.14.1-3ubuntu0.1 libsvn-perl - 1.14.1-3ubuntu0.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5279-1 -- util-linux vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that util-linux incorrectly handled unmounting FUSE filesystems. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to unmount FUSE filesystems belonging to other users. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5279-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: libfdisk-dev - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2.2 libblkid1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2.2 libmount-dev - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2.2 rfkill - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2.2 mount - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2.2 libsmartcols1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2.2 util-linux-locales - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2.2 bsdextrautils - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2.2 libmount1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2.2 libfdisk1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2.2 libsmartcols-dev - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2.2 uuid-dev - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2.2 libblkid-dev - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2.2 fdisk - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2.2 eject - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2.2 uuid-runtime - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2.2 util-linux - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2.2 libuuid1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2.2 No subscription required bsdutils - 1:2.36.1-8ubuntu2.2 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5491-1 -- Squid vulnerability
metadata.description: Joshua Rogers discovered that Squid incorrectly handled the Gopher protocol. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Squid to crash, resulting in a denial of service. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5491-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: squid-common - 4.13-10ubuntu5.1 squid-openssl - 4.13-10ubuntu5.1 squid - 4.13-10ubuntu5.1 squid-cgi - 4.13-10ubuntu5.1 squid-purge - 4.13-10ubuntu5.1 squidclient - 4.13-10ubuntu5.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5311-2 -- containerd regression
metadata.description: USN-5311-1 released updates for contained. Unfortunately, a subsequent update reverted the fix for this CVE by mistake. This update corrects the problem. We apologize for the inconvenience. Original advisory details: It was discovered that containerd allows attackers to gain access to read- only copies of arbitrary files and directories on the host via a specially- crafted image configuration. An attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5311-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: containerd - 1.5.9-0ubuntu1~21.10.3 golang-github-containerd-containerd-dev - 1.5.9-0ubuntu1~21.10.3 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5311-1 -- containerd vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that containerd allows attackers to gain access to read- only copies of arbitrary files and directories on the host via a specially- crafted image configuration. An attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information. Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5311-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: containerd - 1.5.5-0ubuntu3.1 golang-github-containerd-containerd-dev - 1.5.5-0ubuntu3.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5399-1 -- libvirt vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that libvirt incorrectly handled certain locking operations. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to cause libvirt to stop accepting connections, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. (CVE-2021-3667) It was discovered that libvirt incorrectly handled threads during shutdown. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to cause libvirt to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS and Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. (CVE-2021-3975) It was discovered that libvirt incorrectly handled the libxl driver. An attacker inside a guest could possibly use this issue to cause libvirtd to crash or stop responding, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS, Ubuntu 20.04 LTS, and Ubuntu 21.10. (CVE-2021-4147) It was discovered that libvirt incorrectly handled the nwfilter driver. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to cause libvirt to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2022-0897) It was discovered that libvirt incorrectly handled the polkit access control driver. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to cause libvirt to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS and Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. (CVE-2020-25637) It was discovered that libvirt incorrectly generated SELinux labels. In environments using SELinux, this issue could allow the sVirt confinement to be bypassed. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS and Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. (CVE-2021-3631) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5399-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: libvirt-dev - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1.2 libvirt-wireshark - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-driver-qemu - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1.2 libvirt-login-shell - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-system-sysv - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-driver-lxc - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1.2 libnss-libvirt - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-config-nwfilter - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-iscsi-direct - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-config-network - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1.2 libvirt-clients - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-zfs - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-driver-xen - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-driver-vbox - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-gluster - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-system - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1.2 libvirt0 - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-system-systemd - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1.2 libvirt-sanlock - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-rbd - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1.2 libvirt-doc - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1.2 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5292-1 -- snapd vulnerabilities
metadata.description: James Troup discovered that snap did not properly manage the permissions for the snap directories. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2021-3155) Ian Johnson discovered that snapd did not properly validate content interfaces and layout paths. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to inject arbitrary AppArmor policy rules, resulting in a bypass of intended access restrictions. (CVE-2021-4120) The Qualys Research Team discovered that snapd did not properly validate the location of the snap-confine binary. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to execute other arbitrary binaries and escalate privileges. (CVE-2021-44730) The Qualys Research Team discovered that a race condition existed in the snapd snap-confine binary when preparing a private mount namespace for a snap. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2021-44731) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5292-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: ubuntu-core-snapd-units - 2.54.3+21.10.1 ubuntu-core-launcher - 2.54.3+21.10.1 snap-confine - 2.54.3+21.10.1 ubuntu-snappy-cli - 2.54.3+21.10.1 golang-github-snapcore-snapd-dev - 2.54.3+21.10.1 snapd-xdg-open - 2.54.3+21.10.1 snapd - 2.54.3+21.10.1 golang-github-ubuntu-core-snappy-dev - 2.54.3+21.10.1 ubuntu-snappy - 2.54.3+21.10.1 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5292-4 -- snapd regression
metadata.description: USN-5292-1 fixed a vulnerability in snapd. Unfortunately that update introduced a regression that could break the fish shell. This update fixes the problem. We apologize for the inconvenience. Original advisory details: James Troup discovered that snap did not properly manage the permissions for the snap directories. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2021-3155) Ian Johnson discovered that snapd did not properly validate content interfaces and layout paths. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to inject arbitrary AppArmor policy rules, resulting in a bypass of intended access restrictions. (CVE-2021-4120) The Qualys Research Team discovered that snapd did not properly validate the location of the snap-confine binary. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to execute other arbitrary binaries and escalate privileges. (CVE-2021-44730) The Qualys Research Team discovered that a race condition existed in the snapd snap-confine binary when preparing a private mount namespace for a snap. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2021-44731) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5292-4` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: ubuntu-core-snapd-units - 2.54.3+21.10.1ubuntu0.2 ubuntu-core-launcher - 2.54.3+21.10.1ubuntu0.2 snap-confine - 2.54.3+21.10.1ubuntu0.2 ubuntu-snappy-cli - 2.54.3+21.10.1ubuntu0.2 golang-github-snapcore-snapd-dev - 2.54.3+21.10.1ubuntu0.2 snapd-xdg-open - 2.54.3+21.10.1ubuntu0.2 snapd - 2.54.3+21.10.1ubuntu0.2 golang-github-ubuntu-core-snappy-dev - 2.54.3+21.10.1ubuntu0.2 ubuntu-snappy - 2.54.3+21.10.1ubuntu0.2 No subscription required

metadata.title: 5395-2 -- networkd-dispatcher regression
metadata.description: USN-5395-1 fixed vulnerabilities in networkd-dispatcher. Unfortunately that update was incomplete and could introduce a regression. This update fixes the problem. We apologize for the inconvenience. Original advisory details: It was discovered that networkd-dispatcher incorrectly handled internal scripts. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a race condition, escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-29799, CVE-2022-29800) Update Instructions: Run `sudo ua fix USN-5395-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: networkd-dispatcher - 2.1-2ubuntu0.21.10.2 No subscription required

(CVE-2021-3839) It was discovered that DPDK incorrectly handled inflight type messages. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause DPDK to consume resources, leading to a denial of service.
